result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucass Merritt Fieck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court allows to report to P&P by 4pm Monday July 11, 2022.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. 
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall not go on the premises at victim business.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Shall pay $100 Fine + Costs.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

timeConds.notes:
Shall serve 60 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 8/12/22
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucass Merritt Fieck

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
3:04 PM Defendant Lucass Merritt Fieck in court. Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Steven John Luchsinger in court for Lucass Merritt Fieck. Court reviews agreement, rights, charges, and penalties.
As to count 1, the def enters a plea of no contest, Court makes findings and enters conviction on count 1. Counts 2,3, and 4 are DRI. Victims rights compliance has been met. Sentencing arguments heard; def does not make statement. Court heard.
Court imposes the following sentence:
Withheld
Def if placed on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
60 days in DCJ w/ h&t--Court grants 4 days of sentence credit (if revoked). To commence---August 12th by 6 pm
$100 fine+ court costs
Not to go on premises of victim
Not to possess controlled substances without valid Rx
AODA and follow through with all recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol
Participate in any counseling recommended by Agent
DNA + costs
To report by 4 pm on Monday, July 11th on to probation
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

09:34 AM Defendant Lucass Merritt Fieck in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; tsc set; bail con't  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim business.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

12:50 PM Defendant Lucass Merritt Fieck in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible).  Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lucass Merritt Fieck appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim business.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
